page.title: 11The County Fire Headquarters
page.content: When there is an emergency anywhere in the whole of Essex it is received at the Central Computerised Control Room at Fire Brigade Headquarters in Hutton.The Headquarters were opened in 1977 by the Duchess of Kent.The old Headquarters which at one time was a children's home have been turned into flats. Almost 15,000 emergency calls are dealt with each year,one tenth are malicious ones.The calls range from chimney fires which only need one fire engine to major incidents where twenty or more appliances are needed. The computer has all the addresses of special premises,streets and place names in the county. We were told that firemen aren't called firemen any more because women are now doing the job as well.Everyone is now called a firefighter.
